unsigned int  minY,
unsigned int  maxX,
unsigned int  maxY 
)

returns a number that identifies the group.

calculate the width and height of the group.

make sure that the group isn't too large.

scale the values so that they fit within the lowres map correctly.

calculate the mip scale.

if the mip is less than the lowres mip, then we need to place the data in the detail atlas.

scan over pixels in the lowres map.

check the current lowres block to see if we need to upload data to it.

scan over pixels in the lowres map.

check the current lowres block to see if we need to upload data to it.

if the current pixel is an indirection into the detail atlas, then we need to write the value to the detail atlas.

fill our value into the detail atlas.

if the current mip-level is of higher detail than the mip-level already in the atlas, then we need to overwrite the current pixel.

write the mip-scale.

write the placement in the cache.

return 0 for now.

void GrUberTileAtlas::BindLowResAtlas ( unsigned int  sampler  ) 

binds the atlas specified.

Atlas format notes: red = scale-UV, green = offset-U, blue = offset-V. in the shader:

  • if red > 0.75, then use the fallback texture.
  • if alpha == 0, then use the lowres atlas for UVs for the - if alpha == 1, then use the lowres atlas for detail atlas in all, this means there are 2 lookups for each texture channel (bump, diffuse, specular), and 2 atlas lookups. This means that a total of 8 samplers are necessary, but things can be done to limit bandwidth requirements. For instance, when a texture isn't used, we can sample from 0,0 to ensure that we're not pulling data into the texture cache.
